reporting-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

description.narrative: This activity concerns the recruitment of a consultant to conduct a Q@E study for the programme proposal HortInclude by SNV to assess the relevance and modalities of the proposed intervention. The evaluation will focus on assessing the quality of the proposed interventional strategies, how realistic the proposed interventions are within the given timeframe and context, and the quality of the theory of change used. It will furthermore look into the capacity of the implementing parties to manage and execute the interventional strategies successfully, the connection with and governance of the SeedNL initiative for Nigeria, the relationship with the result framework of IGG and the validity of the stakeholder analysis. The above mentioned objectives are not exhaustive but reflect the priorities of the Embassy. Thus, this is not exclusive of other standard evaluation objectives related to value chain development programmes. The project “Hortinclude: Investing in Horticulture and Seed Sector Development in Nigeria” aims to initiate, support and accelerate a horticultural sector and seed sector transformation process in Nigeria. As part of the Q@E process for possible program funding, part of the evaluation will delve into the proposed outcomes of the programme and the chosen approaches to come to these outcomes. The four proposed outcomes are: 1) Sustainably improved crop productivity in the horticultural sector, 2) Service-oriented and sustainable private sector developed, 3) Healthy diets promoted, 4) Improved enabling environment. The three proposed approaches are the following: a) the Food Systems Approach, b) the Dutch Diamond Approach, c) Short-term co-innovation approach. Other components to be addressed are gender and inclusion: assessing the extent to which gender and inclusion are taken into account by the program, and M <(>&<)>E: analyzing the SMART-ness of the program indicators and, if necessary, make suggestions to link it better to the Dutch policy results framework. See Terms of Reference in the Annex.
